author: Special Correspondent
text:
The case over the illegal granite mining in Madurai district, which was probed by Legal Commissioner U. Sagayam, is coming up for hearing in the Madras High Court on Monday.

According to the cause list displayed in the website of the Madras High Court, the case is listed as Item No.12 before the First Bench comprising Chief Justice S.K. Kaul and Justice Pushpa Sathyanarayana.

During the last hearing in November last year, the probe report running over 7,000 pages by Mr. Sagayam was submitted in the High Court which ordered that the copy of the report should not be provided to anyone including the petitioner.

Heavy loss

While hearing a PIL plea filed by activist ‘Traffic’ Ramaswamy, who had alleged that the State had incurred a heavy loss due to the irregularities in the allotment of a mining lease, the High Court had appointed senior IAS officer Mr. Sagayam to probe the issue.

After a year-long investigation of the case of alleged illegal granite mining in the State, Mr. Sagayam submitted his report to the High Court.

It was during the probe by the officer in Madurai district, some persons deposed before him and alleged human sacrifice, which was followed by exhumation of bodies of two mentally-challenged persons.

The operation was personally supervised by Mr. Sagayam himself.
title: Hearing of illegal mining case today
